intro: Styloglossum chrysanthum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to parts of East Asia, including China, Korea, and Japan. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Styloglossum chrysanthum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
